intro: Acipetalum lineatum, commonly known as the slender acacia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its bark is smooth and greyish, while its leaves are pinnately arranged with small, elliptical leaflets. Acipetalum lineatum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
